text: The ability of the eye to focus on objects at various distances is known as
Which colour is deviated least when white light passes through a triangular prism?

text: An electric heater takes 4A when operated on a 250V supply. What is the cost of the electricity consumed at 10k per kWh when the heater is used for 5 hours?
explanation:
Electrical power = current x voltage = IV
but I = 4A and V = 250v
P = 4 x 250 = 1000W → 1KW
Electricity consumed = Power x time
=  1 x 5 = 5kwh
but 1kwh = 10k ( given )
cost of electricity consumed for 5hrs = 5 x 10 = 50k.

text: What is the escape velocity of a satellite launched from the earth’s surface? (Take g as 10ms\(^{-2}\) and the radius of the earth as 6.4 × 10\(^6\)m)
explanation:
V\(_e\) = \(\sqrt{2gr}\)
V\(_e\) = \(\sqrt{2 \times 10 \times 6.4 \times 10^6}\) = 11.313km/s
Theescape speedfrom Earth's surface is about 11.186 km/s

text: What part of the camera corresponds to the iris of the eye?
A block of ice of mass 10kg at 0°C absorbs heat energy from its surroundings and changes to water at the same temperature. The heat absorbed is referred to as
A body executing a simple harmonic motion has an angular velocity of 22 radians per second. If it has a maximum displacement of 10cm, what is its linear velocity?
explanation:
Amplitude[r] =10cm =0.1m.
Angular velocity[w] =22 radians per second
Linear velocity=wrV=22×0.1V=2.2m/s

text: In which simple machine is the effort applied between the load and the fulcrum?
A body of weight 20N displaces 12N of the liquid in which it is immersed. What is the upthrust of the liquid on the body?
If the temperature of a resistance wire is gradually increased, its resistance will

options.C: first increase and then remain the same

explanation: In a metallic resistance wire (a conductor), as the temperature increases, the atoms vibrate more, causing more collisions with the free electrons. This increases the wire's resistance to the flow of current.

text: If the size of the hole of a pinhole camera is increased, the image formed becomes
explanation: If the size of the hole in a pinhole camera is increased, the image formed becomes blurred and larger. This happens because a larger hole allows more light to enter, creating a larger image. However, the increased size also causes a wider range of rays from different points to converge, resulting in a loss of sharpness and a blurred image. Thus, the image is both larger and blurrier.

text: A man stands in front f a high wall and produces a sound. If he receives the echo of the sound four seconds later, what is his distance from the wall? [The speed of sound in air is 330ms-1]
A negatively charged rod is brought near the cap of an electroscope. The cap is earthed momentarily while the charge is near to it. The rod is then removed. Which statement is correct?

options.A: The cap will be positively charged and the leaf will be negatively charged
options.B: The cap will be negatively charged and the leaf will be positively changed
options.C: The cap and the leaf will be positively charged
options.D: The cap and the leaf will be negatively charged

explanation: When a negatively charged rod is brought near an electroscope, it repels electrons, making the cap positively charged and the leaves negatively charged. If the cap is earthed while the rod is near, electrons flow in, neutralizing some positive charge and making the cap negatively charged. After removing the rod and disconnecting the earthing, the cap retains extra electrons and remains negatively charged, while the leaves may also be negatively charged depending on their electron loss. Thus, both the cap and the leaves are negatively charged.

text: Which radiation is emitted when a beam of fast moving cathode rays is stopped by a heavy element?
An object is projected with a velocity of 50ms-1 from ground level at an angle θ to the vertical. If the total time of flight of the projectile is 5s, what is the value of θ? (g = 10ms-2)
explanation:
Time of flight =\( \frac{2Usin\theta}{g}\)
T = 5, g = 10m/s2
\(5 = \frac {2\times 50sin\theta}{10}\)
\(sin\theta =\frac {50}{100}\)
\(\theta = 30\)
vertical angle = 90 - 30 = 60°

text: When a current of 1 .0A flows in an electrolyte for 3.0h, a mass of 1 .0g is deposited. What mass will be deposited in 10.0h if a current of 3.0A flows through the electrolyte?
explanation: Q = chargei = currentt = time in secMass(M1)3hours to sec60*60*3= 10800Mass(M2)10hours to sec60*60*10 = 36,00036,000 * 3.0A = 108,000if it takes 10800 current to discharge 1ghow much will it take 10800010800---->1108000---x= 108000/10800=10

text: An object weighing 0.60N is hung on a spiral spring and caused it to extend by 6.0cm. The object is removed and a black of wood replacing it causes the spring to extend by 10.0cm. What is the weight of the block of wood?
explanation:
From Hooke's law... F = ke
From the first statement
0.6 = k x 0.06
k = \(\frac{0.6}{0.06}\) = 10N/m
From second statement
F = weight of the block = ke
F = 10 x 0.1 = 1.0N
NOTE: Extension (cm → m)
